rComments: Took this class during the summer and it was pretty easy. Not a lot of hw to do, and it's relatively easy. Tests are pretty easy and very similar to the examples given in class. Lectures can get sorta boring, but it's still an ok class.
Definitely take her class. Tests are very similar to the iclicker questions, so just study off that and you will do fine.
Worst economics course I even taken at UCSC.
She is a great teacher and will explain things well. I loved going to class. The classes go by quick and she makes it interesting. I wish she could teach all my subjects.
Easy intro, just pay attention you got this
Easy class simple enough, go to lecture no need to buy textbook or go to section

Dr. Gonzalez will give you all the information you need to succeed in her class. More than likely though she'll end up behind on her lecture schedule which means that she'll breeze through topics faster than anyone would like. The TA's are semi-helpful and the HW can be confusing. 2 midterms. 1 final. All are weighted equally.
ok
She's ok

I also had Julie for Econ 1. My favorite thing about her is that her class was fairly straightforward. She teaches you exactly what topics are going to be tested on her exams. Lectures sometimes drag because they are very dense with information and lack personal enthusiasm. As a professor, she's pretty bland, but she's good with her material.

2-3 homework assignments every week.2 midterms, 1 final. Homework was extremely easy, but the midterms and final were a little more difficult. Read the book, really understand it, go to your sections. Her powerpoint lectures are really helpful, make sure you pay attention and write down her notes.

I had Julie for both Econ 1 and 2 and I loved her! Very straightforward and helpful! If you understand the homework and the iClicker questions she asks in class, you will do just fine.  Her voice is a bit boring, but she is great at helping you understand the material.

Julie ruined this class for me. All of her exams are computational yet she talks about the theory for 75% of her lectures. The only practice material we were given is the practice problems from the textbook (gives no supplemental resources) Useless class to take with her - won't get as much out of it as you should have. Not difficult class to pass

I wouldn't suggest taking Julie for 100A at all cost, there are tons of good 100a professor out there. 100A is a complex subject and Julie teaches striaght from the book which you can tell won't get you anywhere. Her exams are okay if you know are able to find the answer PDF online from textbook like I did. I get an A from this class from the PDF.
Julie is very straightforward with all her exams, they are always very similar to her homework problems. She also clearly wants students to succeed.

I actually enjoyed Julie's class a lot. Her lectures may be a bit bland, but I loved how she hand wrote on the slides. I never felt rushed when I was taking notes. Go to lecture and attend the final review sessions because she and her TAs often go over problems that are on the exams! Julie was fairly straight forward and does not try to trick you!

Julie was a good professor. During her lectures she always had a ton of examples that helped outline the material. Her tests aren't insanely difficult; the questions she gives out in class are much harder, but very helpful. She's helpful and always answered my questions when I went up to her after class. Study hard, go to class & you will do well.
SO HARD.
Julie is a great professor. I took econ 100a with her over the summer. Do  the hw problems, she assign in class and review them before the test and you will do fine in the class.

Very nice teacher, wants the best for her students and is always willing to help you out. The class is easy if you study and pay attention to her lectures. Very book-centered class but she makes it funny with personal stories. Would definitely recommend this teacher.
Good overall! midterms= multiple choices and short answers! lectures very important and TAs hold midterm reviews(:

She is the worst teacher I have ever had. She's intelligent but mean and plays favorites. I saw her let several students turn in their homework late but she said to me the next week "that sucks, sorry." She definitely has an attitude and she rushes through lectures. Notes are okay but you end up teaching yourself a lot.

She told our class that the department "stuck" her with teaching Energy Economics. Obviously, this woman has no interest in the subject and can't wait for lecture to be over. Also, her grading is ridiculous. I typically study my ass off and get straight A's in ECON classes, but I got a B- in this one.

lectures are boring. her voice is boring, and doesn't show interest in what she's talking about. she often goes on tangents and u dont know what she's talking about. Talks about her kids WAY too much. Never tells u what will be on exams. Exams are way harder than the HW she claims to study off. If you can avoid her you should.

Easy but pretty boring. Either go to lecture or read the book but you don't have to do both, they're identical. She talks about her kids ALL THE TIME and makes the same jokes about franchises in Santa Cruz, but overall she's nice and will let you redo homework if you need to.
Her lectures are useful. The online homework is helpful as well. The midterms and final are easy if you read the book.

teacher could not care less about students passing. She has no real life concern for the environment and every class feels like she is rushing through the material and can't wait to get out of the classroom. dont take this class unless you are extremely motivated and are willing to teach yourself

Nice teacher but lazy. Class notes are vague, no sample midterms @ all. TA dont communicate with the teacher, some what helpless. The material is not too hard, we just have to guess what the teacher is going to put on the midterms.

Julie was a good teacher. She definitely stuck to the basics. The class was very easy, and she taught the concepts in a way that made them even easier. Midterms are easy! Her only fault is that she can be a bore at times. but overall, I'd recommend her.

On the first day of class, I remember thinking, oh gee she looks stiff and kinda mean. She definitely tries to engage the class but it really doesn't happen. Going to class was pointless and very hard to follow along. I'm sure she's a nice person, but teaching Micro for me ruined Economics for me.but i still want to pursue this major!! gah.

She reads the book as the lecture. If you can pay attention, you do not have to read the book, but she is so boring its almost impossible to hear everything she says. Very monotone and does not make Econ interesting. Quizzes + Homework = very easy but she does not help you study for midterms
Very helpful and lucid lectures. Got the impression she really wanted people to pass.
Shes a pretty good teacher. Class is easy and will answer questions during discussion. She also talks about her personal life to keep the class entertained. I thought she was pretty cool.

I use to like economics in highschool. Intro to economics was REALLY boring. It was not interesting at ALL. She had boring lectures, The homework was stupid online crap, and her 3 midterms and final never matched study guides or study sessions.

Her second midterm, and her final is hard, but she drops one midtrem out of three midterms. Study the Book, it really helps. You can survive without going to class, but going to class will make it easier to understand the material.
Her class was okay.  I had to study for it. She is boring and keeps talking about her children.  I needed to go to lecture because that was what is mostly likely going to be on the test.

really good teacher and her lectures and expectations are clear. she's also a really nice, down to earth person that really cares about her students. reading the book was helpful because she teaches straight out of the book. fairly easy class.

she is a very clear teacher in her lectures, however, she spends too long talking about her chuildren. Tests were laughable...inconceivably easy. Some studying suggested, but you don't have to have the material cold to ace the midterms. There are 3 and the lowest score isdropped. Homework is online once a week and is never at all difficult.

Very simple and straight to the point.  She won't get you excited about anything, but she won't give a class full of bs either.  The tests are VERY easy and she is even willing to give you extra points afterwards if you can plead a decent case.

If I know it was going to be the way it was, I wouldn't have bother going to class.  She appears to be nice but that's about it.  The first midterm is ok but the second midterm and final is just plain hard.  It is not even based on the study guide.  Why bother having a study guide if you're going to be vague about it?!!?!?!

Amazing teaching. Her class is very straight forward and if you attend class you will never have to open your book. Always willing to help. Also very understanding and flexible when it comes to homework, especially when it is a website error. Tells you exactly what to study for tests and gives easy bonus questions that she has gone over in class.
JULIE IS THE BEST!!!! She is so cool and so great at teaching. She loves Joe's pizza so much and incorporates that into her lectures all the time. I GET SO HUNGRY!

She's clear and direct.Go to lecture, take notes, and do the homework. Those who complained of the midterms and final being "hard" were the ones who were sitting in class watching youtube videos and facebooking during lecture. write down everything she says and reread the notes before the tests. Easy A.
Okay, but boring. Straight from the book.
laid back, except for when it is exam time. (patrols the classroom like a hawk)

Attendance is mandatory over the summer as she assigns practice problems in class to check attendance. The exams are very similar to the problems she went over in class, in class practice problems, and HW problems. Make sure you review all of the problems before the exams. Go to MSI sections if you need help with the HW. I got A+ from her Econ 100A
Very good professor.  Engages students during lecture and is actually pretty funny.  Grading scale is fair.

Class is passable if you understand the concepts/practice example problems. She teaches straight from the book except near the 2nd midterm where she changed it up a bit. She's boring but sometimes funny. First midterm was easy, second was difficult, and the final was ok. My class average was high so the curve wasn't too good. Go to section or MSI!
Just ok professor. Really nice in grading. Don't really have to go to class, just read the book. Highly recommend going to sections.

Julie was the first econ professor I have had and she was honestly one of my favorite teachers at UCSC, her jokes are funny, she keeps the class entertained, it was always enjoyable going to class, midterms and finals are pretty straightforward, as long as you actually study, very approachable.
Have this class as your last option unless your an Econ major and have to take it. Homework is fairly easy and nothing like the midterms and final. Do not recommend.

Just finished her final. Test us something that we never learned rather than the hard material she went over with most of the class time. She even plays her iphone the whole time during the final. TA made up the pratice exam problems. She never care about us or try to help us. She thinks her only job is to give a lecture from the book and thats all
She is really direct in class, but that is not a bad thing. I just go to class and didn't really study but was still able to get A+ on both midterms

I'm an econ major taking intro to micro with Julie. This has been my first econ class, and I have really enjoyed it. I just go to lecture, read the chapter, do my homework, and do the practice midterm once and have gotten A's on both midterms. She is crystal clear and I find her really funny in lecture.

Seriously if you are looking up for this professor, just forget about taking it. Unless you are really good at economics, you might be able to get an A. Her midterms are harder than she mentioned. Lectures are boring, yes! i meant boring!! teach straight from the book. Again, unless if u r rly good at economics, dont take her at all cost, horrible.

ECON MAJORS! DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! She is very difficult. Her teaching is clear, but the tests are insanely hard. She tries to help you pass, but she is not easy to talk to for  help. Ive gone to MSI, crashed Multiple sections,study sessions on the weekends, and her office hours and still not even averaging a C.
I studied, and I did not do well. : (

One of the best professors I've had at UCSC! Was in both Econ1 and 100A with her and enjoyed both. Her teaching style is very direct and her expectations couldn't be clearer. Attend lecture, do the homework and you'll be fine. And if you need additional help, just ask, she's more than happy to explain things further or clarify concepts.
I have to agree strongly with the person who commented on how she taught directly from the book. Her lectures are very dry. Easy to get a B.

Teaches straight from the book, her slides in class are seriously just headers from the text and her definitions match the ones in the book word for word. Her tests are harder than any of the material in the reviews and homework and she just randomly selects homework/midterms from the online text with little discretion.

She is really boring. And if you do take her take good notes cause she talks about things very causally that are very important to remember. And her tests are way harder than the study guide makes them look but there is no homework.

Do NOT take her. Her lectures were ridiculously boring, and tests were comprised of all mini-essays/short answers. Studied very hard for all tests and still ended up with a B- in class. Tests averages were always in the 60's or the 70's and she would only give a two pt curve. Take Gil for 100A instead.

I had her last year for 100A and thought she was an excellent teacher.  She was younger, so she was easy to talk to and she was very understanding.  Very helpful during office hours and recognizes students who try. I recommend her for any econ class

I really like her.  She is teaching this class for the second time and she seems to know what she is doing and if she doesn't have the answer to something she will have it the next class.  She is a younger professor maybe thats why lectures are more interesting.  Still taking the class so I will get back to you!
it was her first year teaching when I took her class, overall good experience.

Not very organized in her clarity for the course.  Also had her for Advanced Micro Econ, the level of boredom is unbearable, as none of the material is ever made interesting in the slightest way. Quite unhelpful as well. Definitely not recommendable for university level of teaching.
No Comments
She is one of the worst teachers I have had. She attempts to teach the math component via power point. Avoid her if you can.

Pretty good lecturer. Seemed kinda cold the first few weeks, but she relaxed and became more personable. Class does get boring sometimes, but she uses pretty simple explanations. The exams had low averages, but I thought questions were fair and straight forward. She emphasizes what you need to know during lecture. Easy on the eyes and recommended.
Easy class. Straight forward teaching style. Effective overall.
No Comments

We just had our last lecture the other day and this class was very poorly taught.  In addition to the fact that she didn't seem to know the material i also thought that she was very unpleasent to most of the students in the class.  Taught out of a horrid textbook in addition. F+ maybe...
No Comments
